title: Alexis Sanchez scores first Inter goal before being sent off for diving against Sampdoria
text:
Alexis Sanchez went from hero to zero on Saturday after scoring his first goal for Inter before being sent off for diving against Sampdoria.

Sanchez had a hand in Inter's opener on 20 minutes when his 25 yard shot was deflected home off the back of Stefano Sensi.

The goal was credited to Sensi but two minutes later Sanchez scored a goal all of his own when he found himself unmarked in the six-yard box and tapped home.

Alexis Sanchez was sent off in the second half after picking up a second booking for diving

Sanchez had earlier scored his first goal for Inter with a finish from close range to make it 2-0

But Sanchez's dream afternoon then came to a shuddering halt when he was sent off for a second bookable offence at the start of the second half.

After Lautaro Martinez burst into the Sampdoria penalty area and saw his one-on-one effort saved by Matteo Raspa, Sanchez ran onto the loose ball inside the area.

But as he looked to take a touch of the ball ahead of the defender in front of him, the on loan Manchester United forward tumbled to the ground in search of a penalty.

Sanchez's one-match suspension will mean he misses next week's Serie clash with Juventus

🔴 SANCHEZ SENT OFF FOR DIVING!



🙈 Two goals and now a red card for Alexis Sanchez on his first start for Inter! pic.twitter.com/ceK4VWNvaO — Premier Sports 📺 (@PremierSportsTV) September 28, 2019

However, the referee was having none of it and immediately brandished a yellow card followed by a red, with Sanchez having already been booked for an earlier foul.

The 30-year-old attempted to protest his innocence but replays showed he had tried to con the referee, resulting in his afternoon being brought to a premature end.

Minutes later, Sampdoria pulled a goal back through Jakub Jankto, but Inter responded with a third to give themselves breathing space when Roberto Gagliardini found the back of the net on 61 minutes.

Inter held on for the three points to stay two clear of Juventus at the summit.

However, Sanchez's red card could come back to haunt Inter as his one-match ban will mean he misses next week's top-of-the-table clash with Juventus.
description: Alexis Sanchez went from hero to zero on Saturday after scoring his first goal for Inter before being sent off after picking up a second bookable offence for diving against Sampdoria.
